member.name: T:AccuAccount.Data.DataContext
member.summary: Provides data access to the database in a unit-of-work pattern.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.DataContext.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AccuSystems.Data.DataContext class that gets its connection string from App.config.
member.remarks: Will read the connection string from Db.xml on disk. If one is not present this constructor call may fail.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.DataContext.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AccuAccount.Data.DataContext class with the specified provider specific connection string.
member.remarks: Prefer to use DataContext(AccuAccountApplication) constructor instead.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.DataContext.GetAccountFields(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets a AccountFieldRow object containing a collection of AccountFields.
member.param: The primary key for the account who owns the fields.
member.returns: Returns a new AccountFieldRow populated with AccountFields, or null if one does not exist.
member.exception: Thrown when an exception occurs related to the database connection or command execution.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.DataContext.GetCollateralFields(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets a CollateralFieldRow object containing a collection of CollateralFields.
member.param: The primary key for the account who owns the fields.
member.returns: Returns a new CollateralFieldRow populated with CollateralFields, or null if one does not exist.
member.exception: Thrown when an exception occurs related to the database connection or command execution.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.DataContext.GetCustomerFields(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets a CustomerFieldRow object containing a collection of CustomerFields.
member.param: The primary key for the account who owns the fields.
member.returns: Returns a new CustomerFieldRow populated with CustomerFields, or null if one does not exist.
member.exception: Thrown when an exception occurs related to the database connection or command execution.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.DataContext.SaveChanges(AccuAccount.Data.FlexFieldRow)
member.summary: Saves any changes made to the specified flex field and persists them to the database.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows affected.
member.devdoc: Business Rule: The only changes that are permitted to a flex field are the display label and value.
member.exception: Thrown when an exception occurs related to the database connection or command execution.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.DataContext.AddNewAccountDocuments(System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Data.Objects.ObjectParameter,System.Data.Objects.ObjectParameter)
member.summary: This stored procedure is needed to create documents for new accounts/collaterals where the documentDefinition has differing defaultDocumentStatusTypes (e.g. new defaultStatusType vs. existing defaultStatusTypes). This is needed as the document redesign did not take these differences into account and assume missing documentTab/document records will always use defaultExistingDocumentStatusType. This assumption affects how documents are treated by Exceptions and need to be changed to allow Importer and the Web applications to add documents into the database for New Accounts/Collaterals where the documentTab/document does not exist and the defaultStatusTypes are different.
member.param: The account id.
The date the account was originated.
Error code returned from SQL Server.
Error message returned from SQL Server.
member.returns: Returns a System.Data.Objects.ObjectResult<String> as an enumerable collection of objects.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.DataContext.AddNewCreditDocuments(System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Data.Objects.ObjectParameter,System.Data.Objects.ObjectParameter)
member.summary: This stored procedure is needed to create documents for new customers where the documentDefinition has differing defaultDocumentStatusTypes (e.g. new defaultStatusType vs. existing defaultStatusTypes). This is needed as the document redesign did not take these differences into account and assume missing documentTab/document records will always use defaultExistingDocumentStatusType. This assumption affects how documents are treated by Exceptions and need to be changed to allow Importer and the Web applications to add documents into the database for New Accounts/Collaterals where the documentTab/document does not exist and the defaultStatusTypes are different.
member.param: The account id.
The date the account was originated.
Error code returned from SQL Server.
Error message returned from SQL Server.
member.returns: Returns a System.Data.Objects.ObjectResult<String> as an enumerable collection of objects.

member.summary: Adds the specified event data to the log entry.

member.summary: Returns a representation of this object.

member.summary: Provides a unified logging experience for AccuAccount enabled applications.

member.summary: Instantiates the class.

member.summary: Adds the specified to the queue.

member.summary: Adds a log entry to the log queue.

member.summary: Adds a log entry to the log queue.

member.summary: Adds a log entry to the log queue.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.Logging.Log.Flush
member.summary: Inserts the contents of the log queue into the database and deletes them from the queue.

member.name: P:AccuAccount.Data.Logging.Log.EnableConsoleOutput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether output will be generated when a log is queued.

member.name: P:AccuAccount.Data.Logging.Log.EnableDebugOutput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether output will be generated when a log is queued.

member.name: P:AccuAccount.Data.Logging.Log.EnableTraceOutput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether output will be generated when a log is queued.

member.name: P:AccuAccount.Data.Logging.Log.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application that is executing the action logging.
member.remarks: The source is initially set in the static type initializer to the name of the calling assembly. Setting this property will override the automatically detected value.

member.name: P:AccuAccount.Data.Logging.Log.SourceVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the version number of the application that is executing the action of logging.
member.remarks: The source version is initially set in the static type initializer to the version of the calling assembly. Setting this property will override the automatically detected value.

member.name: P:AccuAccount.Data.Logging.Log.Entries
member.summary: Gets a of entries that have been queued to be persisted to the database.

member.name: T:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.AccountDuplicationMode
member.summary: Specifies the behavior to use for loans when dealing with duplicate loan numbers.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.AccountDuplicationMode.None
member.summary: Indicates that no two customers can have a loan with the same loan number. In addition, a customer cannot have two loans with the same loan number, regardless of what the LoanType or AccountClass is.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.AccountDuplicationMode.CustomerAndLoan
member.summary: Indicates that different customers can share the same loan number, but a customer cannot have two loans with the same loan number, regardless of what the LoanType or AccountClass is.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.AccountDuplicationMode.CustomerAndLoanAndAccountClass
member.summary: Indicates that different customers can share the same loan number, and a customer can have two loans with the same loan number as long as they are in a different AccountClass.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.AccountDuplicationMode.CustomerAndLoanAndAccountClassAndLoanType
member.summary: Indicates that different customers can share the same loan number, and a customer can have two loans with the same loan number as long as they are in a different AccountClass. In addition, a customer may have two loans with the same loan number in the same AccountClass, as long as they have different Loan Types.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.AccountDuplicationMode.Undefined
member.summary: Indicates that the loan duplication mode is not set, which will prevent the import service from running until it is configured to a proper value for the specific bank running importer.

member.name: T:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.DocumentStatus
member.summary: Document statuses for [dbo].[document].[documentStatus]

member.summary: Indicates that the physical file for the document exists.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.DocumentStatus.DocumentNotFound
member.summary: Indicates that the physical file for the document does not exist.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.DocumentStatus.DocumentChanged
member.summary: Indicates that the physical file for the document has changed.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.DocumentStatus.RemoteScan
member.summary: Indicates that the document was scanned remotely.

member.name: T:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.DocumentTypeCode
member.summary: A document type is the type for a document that the document pertains to.
member.remarks: A document can either relate to a customer, account, or collateral. Account and collateral documents are considered one in the same.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.DocumentTypeCode.Account
member.summary: Signifies that a document is a loan document.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.DocumentTypeCode.Credit
member.summary: Signifies that a document is a customer document.

member.name: T:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.ExceptionState
member.summary: The states of an Exception.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.ExceptionState.None
member.summary: Indicates that a bank exception is not an active exception.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.ExceptionState.Pending
member.summary: Indicates that a bank exception is a pending exception.

member.name: F:AccuAccount.Data.Objects.ExceptionState.Exception
member.summary: Indicates that a bank exception is an active exception.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.Rules.BankExceptionRules.GetExceptionStateWeight(System.Char)
member.summary: Gets the weighted value for the specified exception state.
member.param: The AccuAccount.Data.Objects.ExceptionState to get the associated weight value for.
member.returns: Returns an integer value that represents the weighted value of the exception's state.

listheader.description: Desribes the possible weighted values of an exception's state.

item.description: The weighted value of ExceptionState.None is 0.
The weighted value of ExceptionState.Pending is 1.
The weighted value of ExceptionState.Exception is 2.

member.name: T:AccuAccount.Data.SignatureDevice
member.summary: Represents a row of data in the SignatureDevices table.
member.remarks: A signature device is an iPad, Android, Surface, or other mobile device that supports a signature application, such as PDF Expert. The device must support such an application that has the capabilities to digitally sign documents, as well as synchronize them with a folder share, WebDAV, FTP, or other related service.

member.name: M:AccuAccount.Data.SignatureDevice.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AccuAccount.Data.SignatureDevice class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the device name.

member.name: P:AccuAccount.Data.SignatureDevice.FolderPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder path the device is mapped to.
member.remarks: The folder path can be a relative or absolute path, either physical or UNC.

member.name: T:AccuAccount.Data.SignatureForm
member.summary: Represents a row of data in the SignatureForms database table.
member.remarks: A signature form is a representation of a physical file that is used as a template for defining different areas that may contain information that can be processed via OCR. The various pieces of information that can be processed by OCR, such as a customer number, are defined in document inches by their respective top-left most cordinate, width, and height.

member.summary: Gets or sets the unique id.
